data.prayer: Father, encourage the 75,368 believers in Haikou to not just be consumers of knowledge but be producers of love, mercy, kindness, and justice.
data.verse: let us not love with words or speech but with actions and in truth.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Haikou, Hainan, China
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, please give the church in the county of Haikou prophets who can build up holiness and faithfulness to you.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Father, like with the Ethiopian Eunuch, set up a meeting today between a faithful believer in Haikou, Hainan, China and a person seeking to understand the truth.
data.verse: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?” Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, comfort those who mourn in Haikou, Hainan, China.
data.verse: Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.

data.prayer: Spirit, I pray that the Cun people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Jesus, purify the 75,368 believers in the county of Haikou to not just be hearers, but doers of your Word.
data.verse: Blessed is the one who reads aloud the words of this prophecy, and blessed are those who hear it and take to heart what is written in it, because the time is near.

data.prayer: Spirit, guide seekers in Haikou, Hainan, China to the gospel through searching YouTube or TikTok today.
data.verse: I love those who love me, and those who seek me find me.

data.prayer: Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the county of Haikou access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

location.name: Haikou
location.people_groups_list: Hakka, Hainan Island, Li, Ha, Li, Jiamao, Li, Bendi, Li, Qi
